website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for ease, this Krusteaz gluten-free option is a great value on a one-to-one option.
pros: No need to adjust your measurements
Use the same amount of flour as called for in all recipes
Price is for 8 bags of 2 pounds each
Cooks well in lots of products like cakes and cookies
cons: Be aware this product contains xanthan gum
Some complaints about granular texture that doesn't taste like typical flour

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gf flour!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flour! I used to buy it at SAMS but they stopped carrying it. I've been baking gluten free for 5 years now and this is game changer! It tastes wonderful in everything from gravies to cakes, cookies, and muffins (I haven't tried yeast breads). I was so excited to see it here for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have a wheat intolerance like I do.
customer_reviews.text: I was a good value. Shame on me though for not reading the ingredients first. How can it be gluten free if it contains wheat? And also soy and eggs. Made with cheap ingredients explains the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: char

customer_reviews.title: Pancakes that blew even my own mind
customer_reviews.text: I made the pancakes using the recipe on the bag with a few substitutions to accommodate family allergies. We have quite a collection! So, I used coconut oil and coconut palm sugar and made some pancakes that blew even my own mind. My son said I should publish the recipe to help others, but since it is not my core recipe, I am wary of that, just use the coconut oil and coconut palm sugar, and grease the pan with coconut oil. The pancakes resulting will help you win friends and influence people!
customer_reviews.author: T. Malloy

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose Gluten Free Flour!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this flour. I use it for most of my gluten free baking. There may be certain things that you would prefer another blend for, but this is the one I make sure to have on hand at all times. Cookies, cakes, quick breads, muffins, these are the things I bake the most of and they all turn out great.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great gf all purpose flour
customer_reviews.text: Best all purpose gf flour I’ve used and I’ve tried them all! Works well in combo with other gf products. Does not contain xanthan gum so sometimes need to add gum or another binder. Egg white works well to replace gluten as a protein component.
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a thickener for homemade soups like broccoli cheese where i used to use wheat flour to make the roux. Works great, makes a nice creamy thick consistency and tastes as good as it did with wheat flour. I made a chocolate cake with it which came out kinda dry, perhaps it bakes a little faster? In the future I'll set the timer a few minutes earlier. It's a staple here anyway for cooking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: DoxieGirl

customer_reviews.title: This is the best white flour substitute ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Have not been able to make a gluten free pumpkin roll in over 10 years because none of the flower mixes taste the same as white flour. Same thing with German pancakes. Now I can! From what I remember, this does not taste any different either. I will never try another gluten-free flour mix again. This is the one! Don't even have to adjust my recipes, cup for cup the exact same.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Good Flavor and Consistency
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my muffins and cookies! This flour has a good consistency for my pumpkin chocolate chip muffins. My old-fashioned cookies taste better too.
customer_reviews.author: Pleiades

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Celiac cooking
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite gluten free flour and we use it for all of our baking.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.H.

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free flour you can buy
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have tried many many different gluten-free flours. This one was the best you can buy without cutting off your right arm
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great flour and not gritty like other gf flours
customer_reviews.text: One of the best gluten free flours I’ve tried so far. It is almost like baking with regular flour it’s so close. All gf flours are over priced but at least this one tastes good
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Not for bread
customer_reviews.text: It is terrible flour to make bread but to make gluten-free buttermilk fried chicken it is fantastic. The best I have ever used.bl it is okay to make cookies. And great for carrot cake.
customer_reviews.author: MommyVixen

customer_reviews.title: This item does not bake as well as King Arthur Gluten Free Flour
customer_reviews.text: I made biscuits with this flour and they were flat and grainy. I expected it to as good as King Arthur GF flour but it is not. It was ok and a GREAT price but I will try not to buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Powell

customer_reviews.title: Works well for baking and cooking
customer_reviews.text: I can actually cook a roux with this blend. Have made biscuits to fried shrimp. Thickens Bechamel sauces. Works well as a general AP GF flour.
customer_reviews.author: davisshea

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: The best gluten free flour. This is the only flour that doesn’t ruin everything I bake. I have tried many GF flours and this is hands down the best one. I always order 8 bags at a time so I have enough on hand. I hope this product is never discontinued because I would die without this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Steph S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all purpose GF flour
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite all purpose gluten free flour. It mKes great cookies, quick breads, muffins, pizza crust and more! I can no longer find it locally so now have to purchase on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: allthingsbeautiful

customer_reviews.title: Not gritty like some GF flours
customer_reviews.text: I make bread with this four. It's not gritty like some others I've used. It has good flavor. You wouldn't know it was gluten free. I like it enough to buy it by the case.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: The best gluten free all purpose flour I’ve used.
customer_reviews.text: Always the best gluten free flour. I’ve tried many over the last ten years. I use it for everything and it can be used as a substitute in any recipe.
customer_reviews.author: GNC Family

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pies
customer_reviews.text: Strange at first to use as its heavy even for GF but makes the best piecrust and roll out cookies ever. Gotta refrigerate the dough and probably use wax paper to roll out. Good flavor with butter in the mix. Should make great crust for pot pies also.
customer_reviews.author: Sonlit Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Have purchased Krusteaz products for years and it's great that they have now come out with an all ...
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased Krusteaz products for years and it's great that they have now come out with an all purpose gluten free flour. It's easy to use because it's a one to one replacement and can be substituted in all your favorite recipes. Have made many cakes, cookies and pastries with this Krusteaz flour with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best GF flour that I have used, in 3 years of trying every single brand/blend that I have come across.
customer_reviews.author: Happy2BeReading

customer_reviews.title: Great mix
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this mix is the nutrition - it's not just rice flour and starches! It can smell a little different while cooking because of the millet flour, but everything I've made so far has come out tasting great.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free Cook
customer_reviews.text: We have to eat gluten free and I have tried a lot of different flour subs. This is the best. I use it in all recipes 1 to 1 and it always works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah B. Crow

customer_reviews.title: Best gf all purpose flour I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Best gf all purpose flour I've tried! On occasion, I find adding a smidge of xantham gum will give a bit better density and less crumble for things like basic biscuits, but it is typically just fine as is for most recipes. Use it a few times and see for yourself, it's great, and flavor is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This flour is the best for the price. Everything I make has to be gluten free and you cannot distinguish the taste between this flour and a gluten flour. Cookies and cakes come out very nice. Highly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great Substitute For Wheat Flour
customer_reviews.text: I have family members who are gluten intolerant. This is by far the best substitute flour I have found, and I have tried several. Thank you so much, Krusteaz, for this product! I have used this in cookies, pies, and as a breading on chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best GF flour I have found that allows for an ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best GF flour I have found that allows for an exact swap in recipes calling for normal flour. My second time ordering this and still very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Stene

customer_reviews.title: Good wheat substitute
customer_reviews.text: I like this flour a lot! I wish it didn't have zanthan gum so I could add my own, sometimes it's too much! Makes most items just like wheat flour.
customer_reviews.author: Beth F.

customer_reviews.title: Bag seams might not hold up for shipping
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as described. The packaging was a doubled box, which was good, but one of the bags of flour was split and it made a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good taste and texture
customer_reviews.text: This easily replaces flour in my recipes, and tastes like "normal" food.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Berndt

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product!
customer_reviews.text: The only GF flour I use!!! Its expensive in the store so I buy it off here now. I meam its still not cheap but cheaper than Kroger :-)
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: My favorite GF flour
customer_reviews.text: Krusteaz is my favorite gluten free flour so far. It has more grains than most, and I like the flavor. Not the sticky and grainy feel, nor beany flavor of some others.
customer_reviews.author: Abbasgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good flour. My wife has been making gluten-free bread ...
customer_reviews.text: Good flour. My wife has been making gluten-free bread with it, and it's much better than the frozen stuff. Hopefully Amazon stocks the 8-pack again because that was a really great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: We love this stuff as it lets us enjoy our favorite ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this stuff as it lets us enjoy our favorite recipes without the gluten. When you buy a box of them, this is an unbeatable deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding gluten free flour.
customer_reviews.text: Bakes exactly like all purpose flour. I reorder this by the 8 pack. I use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ann B.

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a gluten allergy and this flour is the closest I've found to regular flour. It's the only one I use.
customer_reviews.author: Littlealost

customer_reviews.title: Best gluten free flour I've found
customer_reviews.text: Best gluten free flour I've found. Pancakes come out tender, not crumbly or mealy and are good enough to eat plain.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R.

customer_reviews.title: Gluten free flour that is easy to substitue in any recipe.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gluten free flour that I have used. I can substitute this flour in my regular recipes and you can not tell that it is gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Groves

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. It is a one to one product. Already has xanthum gum in it which most products don't have. Love, love love.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M. O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Great value. GF can be quite expensive.
customer_reviews.text: We love this stuff for GF recipes. Versatile and much cheaper than many other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R.

customer_reviews.title: works EXACTLY like regular flour!
customer_reviews.text: wonderful product at a great price. makes great pie crusts and cookies and gluten eaters can't tell.
customer_reviews.author: gigglybritches

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite flour! Direct substitute
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite flour! Direct substitute. And I find that most things tend to just taste better when made with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has way too strong of an earthy flavor. I think it's the sorghum.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic alternative to wheat flour. Only wish that they still sold the 5lb bags at sams.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Julia Kurschner

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the closest to regular flour I've found. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth H

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement flour
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement for standard wheat flour. Does not have a nutty taste, which is needed in some cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I make pancakes from the recipe on the back of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Bik

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works just fine though it was an order mistake on my part
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price. I love this mix to make GF, dairy-free and corn-free muffins.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bennett

customer_reviews.title: This is the best gluten free flour mix that I have found
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gluten free flour mix that I have found. It's made with whole grains not just potato/tapoica starches. It does well in recipes when replacing regular flour for this gf flour. Flavor is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This flour is by far the best gluten free flour on the market! Bakes up anything just like regular flour. I never use anything other than Krusteaz
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works very well in my recipes and can be ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well in my recipes and can be used in place of regular flour cup for cup. The expiration date is far enough away (10 months) that there is no worry that I won't be able to use it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for sweetbreads, muffins, and pancakes. Only minor modifications needed for old recipes.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great Gluten Free flour
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product in the pasr with success. It can be used comparably with regular flour by adding xantham gum.
customer_reviews.author: CatS

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. Best gf one to one flour I have found. Use it in baking, cooking. Works the best and cost is ok for being gf
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the new formula
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the new formula. It's really grainy compared to the one I used to buy. I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Love this flour. I use all my old recipes with no extras or modifications. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Tustian

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job and this is a great value
customer_reviews.text: Use this flour for all my gluten free baking. It does a great job and this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I didn't care for it. I tried making scones and pancakes. It had a bitter taste - after taste. We're new to eating low carb, but it doesn't taste as good as others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyLee

product_meta.title: Krusteaz Gluten Free All-Purpose Flour, 32 oz pack of 8
product_meta.description: Get creative in the kitchen with our special gluten free blend of whole grain and brown rice flours. Substitute 1:1 for wheat flour in any recipe. With no artificial colors, flavors or preservatives, Krusteaz Gluten Free Flour is a must for any pantry. Krusteaz Gluten Free Flour comes in an 8 pack of 32-ounce resealable bags that are easy to scoop and store. They say home is where the heart is. For us, that’s the Pacific Northwest – a place known for its natural beauty and balanced way of life, and where we chose to start our family business. It’s also the inspiration behind the food we make. Made with real ingredients and hearty protein, our pancakes, muffins and desserts make it easier to feed your family well, wherever your home is.
feature_bullets: SAME GREAT TASTE: Our gluten free flour is perfect in any recipe that calls for regular flour
EASY CONVERSION: Replace conventional flour with a 1:1 ratio
VERSATILE MIX: Use to make your favorite bread, cookies and other desserts
FAMILIAR INGREDIENTS: No artificial flavors, colors or preservatives
CERTIFIED GLUTEN FREE: All of our gluten free mixes are certified by the Gluten-Free Certification Organization
